overview: Blind Person's Allowance is an extra amount you can earn before paying tax - what you'll get, eligibility and applying
title: Blind Person's Allowance

table.body:
Blind Person’s Allowance means you can get an extra amount of income tax-free each year.

For the tax year 2012 to 2013, the allowance is £2,100.
table.title: Overview

table.body:
For the 2012 to 2013 tax year, you get £2,100 added to your Personal Allowance - this is the amount of income you can get [before paying tax](/income-tax-rates "Income tax rates"). 

If you and your spouse or civil partner are both eligible, you each get an allowance.

You can [transfer your Blind Person's Allowance](/blind-persons-allowance/further-information "Further information about Blind Person's Allowance") to your spouse or civil partner if you don't pay tax or use all of the allowance.
table.title: What you'll get

table.body:
##England and Wales

If you're registered blind with the local council you can claim Blind Person's Allowance.

##Scotland and Northern Ireland

If you're unable to perform work for which eyesight is essential, you can claim Blind Person's Allowance.

table.title: How to claim

table.body:
##Transferring Blind Person's Allowance to your spouse or civil partner

You may be able to transfer your allowance to your spouse or civil partner if you can't use all of it.

If you don't pay tax but your spouse or civil partner does, you can transfer your allowance to them. You can also transfer [Married Couple's Allowance](/married-couples-allowance) if you get it.

###How to transfer your allowance

Download and fill in [form 575 'Notice of transfer of surplus Income Tax allowances'](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/forms/575-t-man.pdf "Form 575 Notice of transfer of surplus Income Tax (PDF 53KB"){:rel="external"}

Contact HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC) if you need the form in an alternative format, eg Braille.

$C
**HMRC**  
Telephone: 0845 366 7887  
Monday to Friday 8am to 8pm  
Saturday 8am to 4pm  
$C

If you're making a claim to get tax back on savings and investment interest using form R40 you can also ask for a copy of form 575 by ticking the appropriate box.

$D
Download ['Form R40 - Claim for repayment of tax deducted from savings and investments' (PDF, 102KB)](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/forms/r40.pdf "Form R40"){:rel="external"}
$D

*[HMRC]: HM Revenue & Customs
